intro: Tetragastris catuaba, commonly known as catuaba, is a small evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Catuaba is known for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional South American medicine. Its botanical features make it an important component of the rainforest ecosystem.
